message: Once we get outside, I realize that we're in the north quarter.
Together, Mink and I head for the east quarter.
I don't know how long I was in that gloomy building, but now the sun is high in the sky.
Mink leads me through the back streets, like he's trying to avoid attention.
I'm not sure if this is just his preference, or if he has a good reason to stay out of sight.
My headache has largely subsided, but I'm still not feeling 100%, so my pace is slow and I start to lag behind.
Every time he turns a corner, I worry I might lose sight of him.
